medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with a 3-month history of progressive shortness of breath, initially attributed to exertion during exercise. A cough productive of purulent sputum developed 1 month prior to presentation, which resolved after treatment for community-acquired pneumonia; however, her shortness of breath relentlessly progressed to symptomatic dyspnea at rest. Dyspnea was exacerbated while upright and improved in the recumbent position.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Recurrent epistaxis since childhood, a spontaneous right hemothorax at age 21, an ischemic stroke at age 25, and hypothyroidism.
medical_history.family_history: Recurrent epistaxis in her brother and son.
medical_history.social_history: Smokes 1 pack of cigarettes per day for the past 30 years and occasionally drinks alcohol.
